error.signature: ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement <package>. No matching distribution found (no binary available for this platform)

verdict.summary: No prebuilt binary wheel is available for the current platform/Python combination. The package needs to be compiled from source, which requires build tools and libraries. Common on Alpine Linux (musl), ARM, or newer Python versions.

dead_ends.why_fails: If no binary exists for the platform, this flag guarantees failure instead of attempting source build

dead_ends.action: Try different PyPI mirrors hoping they have the binary
dead_ends.why_fails: Mirrors replicate the same packages; if PyPI does not have the wheel, mirrors will not either

workarounds.action: Install build dependencies and compile from source
workarounds.how: apt-get install build-essential python3-dev && pip install --no-binary <package> <package>

workarounds.action: Use a manylinux-compatible base image instead of Alpine/musl
workarounds.how: Switch Docker base from python:3.x-alpine to python:3.x-slim which uses glibc and has wheel support

workarounds.action: Build the wheel yourself and host it in a private index
workarounds.how: pip wheel <package> -w ./dist/ on a compatible machine, then pip install --find-links ./dist/ <package>
workarounds.condition: when source build is not possible on target

leads_to.condition: when attempting source build without proper build tools

preceded_by.condition: when platform incompatibility forces source compilation

frequently_confused_with.distinction: No-binary means no prebuilt wheel exists at all for the platform; platform-mismatch means wheels exist but for a different OS/architecture
